page.title: 01OUR AREA OF STUDY
page.content: This is mainly a rural area lying to the South of the A5 trunk road and to the East of the new M42 motorway in the Borough of North Warwickshire.It includes the villages of Baddesley Ensor,Baxterley,Wood End and part of Grendon.The main industry in the area is farming although there are two coal mines,Birch Coppice and Baddesley. People who live in the area either work at the mines or in the nearby towns of Atherstone,Nuneaton or Tamworth.The population tends to be reasonably static and there has been little new housing development in the last ten years.The villages are still very much a close community and there are many recurring family names.The atmosphere is generally quiet with residents enjoying fine views over the surrounding countryside and yet easy access to the large Midland cities.
